p: To obtain confidence intervals (CIs) for the parameters, we used a profile likelihood method (Romero-Severson et al., 2014) where the parameter of interest was varied over a grid of values and the likelihood was calculated, by refitting the data allowing all other parameters to be free. We used the mif2 method (King et al., 2016) in pomp. A local regression (loess) curve was fitted to the profile likelihood curve and both the MLE and CIs were calculated from the interpolated curve (King et al., 2015, 2016).
